node.statement: (Strict positivity) The limit R(phi) = lim R_eps(phi) > 0 for mu-a.e. phi. This follows because R = exp(Psi^{ren} + ...) is the exponential of a real-valued (finite mu-a.s.) random variable, hence strictly positive. Therefore T_psi* mu is absolutely continuous w.r.t. mu with d(T_psi* mu)/d(mu) = R > 0.
